oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Nashville Children's Theatre prepares for Hans Brinker production, 1937 November 28
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Junior League volunteers and children painting a canvas to become a prop for their upcoming performance of Hans Brinker, which was presented December 15-18, 1937. Left to Right: Margaret Philips on ladder, Jane McKelvey Harwell stirring, while Jimmy Manier and Ben Alexander, who played parts in the production, lent helping hands. The Junior League of Nashville, Tennessee, started Nashville Children's Theatre in 1931 to produce plays of cultural and educational value for local children. It is the oldest children's theatre company in America. Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 3.25 x 4.25 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Philips, Margaret; Harwell, Jane McKelvey; Manier, Jimmy; Alexander, Ben
